attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Create a virtual parliamentary constituency for serving armed forces personnel.
attributes.background: The choice of voting for the constituency a Serving Member (and his/her family) find themselves in (when based in the UK) or voting for a constituency they had lived in previously is often unsatisfactory.  In my experience serving members don't vote at all and few use their MP.
attributes.additional_details: The creation of a virtual constituency will give serving members of the Armed Forces and their families the opportunity to vote for a person who will directly represent them in Parliament, regardless of where they are based. Critically it will allow the incumbent MP, regardless of party, to immerse him/herself in the specific needs of serving personnel and their families. This role is to be independent of the MoD and the Minister of State for the Armed Forces which reflect Government needs.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Honour  Paralympians & Olympians by declaring an extra bank holiday in 2016
attributes.background: As a comparatively small island together we have come second in the Medals table for the 2016 Olympics, and are currently second in the Paralympics medal table. This is a quite remarkable achievement.
attributes.additional_details: Lets make it happen, and demonstrate that we are proud of their achievements and know how to celebrate.

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Remove the pension lifetime allowance.We want to be self-reliant in retirement.
attributes.background: The current  lifetime allowance means we will not have enough pension income  in retirement. We want to have enough income so we are not reliant on the state and with a decent pension income, we will fuel the economy. This makes even more sense as the population is ageing. Please think again!
attributes.additional_details: As an example, a final salary pension of £18k p.a. eats up 58% of the lifetime allowance before any further pension savings are made. It does not leave much headroom and will not equate to extravagant riches in old age. Please reconsider the lifetime allowance limit.

attributes.action: Get Saddleworth Back Into West riding of Yorkshire; Separate From Oldham!
attributes.background: In 1866 saddleworth became a civil parish in its own right and in 1889 became part of the administrative county of the West Riding of Yorkshire. In 1894 the parish's boundaries were altered with the parts in Quickmere Middle Division (Springhead), Mossley and Uppermill becoming Urban Districts.
attributes.additional_details: The residue became a single-parish rural district. Unfortunately in 1996 the boundaries were changed for the worst & Saddleworth became a part of Oldham, this needs to be reverted back! we should be our own district again belonging to west Yorkshire. please sign this petition to get our boundaries changed back!

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: "Superfast" (Fibre) broadband should be made available to Exchange Only lines
attributes.background: During the current "superfast" broadband rollout, many properties are being excluded because they are not connected to roadside cabinets. When these properties were originally connected to their local telephone exchange, cabinets were not in standard use.
attributes.additional_details:
Current regulations say that the new "superfast" technology must be installed outside exchanges in cabinets. Therefore new cabinets should be installed outside existing exchanges (to comply with current regulations) or the regulations should be changed.

Currently the public money being spent on these projects is done so without public consultation. Homeowners and businesses cannot interact with the organisers implementing the projects to ensure fair distribution.

attributes.action: Restrict the speed of cyclists on mixed pedestrian/cyclist paths to 4 mph.
attributes.background: It is becoming very common for local authorities to improve provision for cyclists, at the expense of pedestrians, by making footpaths multi use. By the simple expedient of painting a bicycle on the footpath pedestrians lose the exclusive use of the footpath.
attributes.additional_details:
The figures for death and serious injury to pedestrians involved in accidents with cyclists is very low. But there is a perception of danger especially from inconsiderate riders.
If cyclists were restricted, to 4 mph as are class 2 mobility scooters, this would reduce the perceived threat from cyclists. This would create a compromise in mixing pedestrians with cyclists. This accepts the inevitable use by cyclists of the footpath and protects pedestrians as vulnerable road users.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly £580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: All petrol/diesel pumps must display taxes taken per litre and per gallon.
attributes.background: Most people aren't aware that the vast majority of the cost of fuel doesn't go to the oil companies who have to drill to find the stuff, transport it around the world, refine it, and deliver it to your local garage, but to the state that has done none of this.
attributes.additional_details: The sum of taxes should include VAT and the taxation of the oil companies and the garages or stores who provide the pumps.

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Free First Aid courses
attributes.background: First Aid courses should be available for free as it is a life skill which all of the public should know. This will encourage the public to be good citizens and respect their society.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all school children to learn sign language.
attributes.background: Personally, I feel like sign language should be something everyone should know. Im not deaf nor do I know anyone who is but I can easily empathise with the deaf community and can understand that a world where most people are unable to communicate with you must be rather terrifying.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.actiononhearingloss.org.uk/your-hearing/ways-of-communicating/british-sign-language-bsl.aspx

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Jail for 30 days if you leave pets/children unnattended in cars on a hot day.
attributes.background: The amount of people leaving their pets in hot cars on a summers day is insane. People know the dangers but dont seem to care. I propose a minimum jail term of 30 days for people who commit this act against animals or children.
attributes.additional_details: evidence is everywhere

attributes.action: Make the smoking of tobacco in a household with children under 18 an offense.
attributes.background: In England there is already a ban on smoking in a car with children under 18, however smoke can linger within rooms of a home for long periods of time, this and smoke residue that falls on food and surfaces can put children the most at risk of health problems as their lungs are not fully developed.
attributes.additional_details:
"It’s estimated that, every year, second-hand smoke kills over 12,000 people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and the lung disease Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)."
- Cancer Research UK

http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking#qUzJibFS5IwmCGXk.99

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: ARM must remain a majority UK owned company.
attributes.background: ARM is probably the most successful UK Tech Company. Ownership of this vital sector is disappearing into foreign hands at an alarming rate. The UK Government should hold a golden share.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa May the new Prime Minister has just said some UK vital companies may be protected. ARM is one of these. This should be debated in Parliament at the earliest opportunity.

attributes.action: Use Dog DNA to solve dog pooh problems
attributes.background: Dogs create around 1000 tons of pooh per day in the UK. Current initiatives are not effective in forcing owners to pick up their dogs pooh. As dogs now have to be microchipped, I propose that their DNA is included in the information on the microchip. This in turn can be used to trace the owners.

attributes.action: Theresa May; Appoint a Minister of State for Climate Change
attributes.background: In Theresa May's first Cabinet appointments she abolished the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change moving the brief with Business. To ensure that Climate Change is at the heart of British politics we want a Climate Change Minister to work with all departments.
attributes.additional_details: Since the creation of the Energy and Climate Change department, climate change policy has largely been driven by using more sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister working in the Business department  could design new climate change policies that are not only just focused on sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister could be responsible for growing the green economy and encouraging corporate social responsibility.

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Make prejudicial, unfactual and opinion/vote swaying news reporting criminal.
attributes.background: UK media is now completely corrupted & has become a weapon of mass destruction in itself. We urgently need revised legislation, to ensure that it is no longer used as a tool to sway public opinion in false or self destructive directions. We need this now for the good of the UK & more so for mankind.
attributes.additional_details: VOTE LEAVE TODAY was the front cover of the Daily Express, on the day of the EU referendum. A newspaper should report news for the benefit of the people. Not sway opinion for its own secret agendas. The first 24 hours after the killings in Nice, BBC and all news outlets kept stating Mohamed Bouhlel had no known terrorist links. Yet in the same breath, kept claiming it to be a war act & terrorist attack. If no links, this reporting is biased & inflammatory. Set laws now to stop the propaganda.

attributes.action: Increase the UK's military response against ISIS
attributes.background: The UK has been a part of a US-led coalition against ISIS for nearly two years. In that time period terrorist attacks around the world and against our allies have increased dramatically. We must increase our military efforts to ensure our safety and the safety of our allies by destroying ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: The death toll from ISIS terrorist attacks was 9 in 2013, increased to 1,020 in 2015 and is currently at 840 in 2016 after the horrific attack in Nice. The numbers of attacks continue to increase and ISIS continue to target some of our greatest allies such as Belgium, France and the United States. We must increase our efforts against ISIS to ensure that we are safe from terrorist attacks and to ensure the freedoms we hold so dear are protected.

attributes.action: Change the driving license rules for up to 7.5 tonne vehicles.
attributes.background: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1996 needs to be adapted to include C1 and C1E category after provisional on a background check-points basis so that all the people who were born from 1979 onwards get the same driving possibilities as those who passed their driving test before 1996.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today, anyone who has passed their driving test prior to 1996 can drive any vehicle up to 7.5 tonnes. In 1998 this meant that a few thousand 18 and 19 year-olds were left out of the equation but by 2016, not only everybody from 18 to 37 (roughly 16.8 million people) can't drive a large van or small lorry but your 75 year-old granny can. This leaves many responsible grown-ups finding it very difficult when needing to drive, hire or purchase any vehicle between 3.5 and 7.5 tonnes.

attributes.action: Make the offence of misconduct in a public office statutory, to include MP's.
attributes.background: It is alleged that some MP's knowingly lied about the facts to the public during the recent EU referendum thereby causing those members of the public to vote in a way they would not have done if in possession of the true facts. The current law of misconduct in a public office is unclear.
attributes.additional_details: The current law on misconduct in public office is not statutory,  and there is a limited definition of who holds public office which does not include MP's. The law needs to be placed on statute and MP's should be included in the definition of holders of public office and liable to commit the offence except where parliamentary privilege exists. This would mean that MP's could be prosecuted where they abuse the public's trust in the office holder by, for example, lying in a referendum debate.

attributes.action: Fund our NHS with an additional £3billion per annum using former EU finances
attributes.background: Our national health service is wavering under the weight of increased expectations and lack of funding. This petition would like to see that NHS staff are paid and treated fairly, compensated properly for any work related illness and supported through any work related illness as may be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: In addition to this there are an increased number of reports of missing medical records that are needed to claim work related illness compensation. The funds should be drawn from the savings of leaving the EU as suggested by the leave campaign. Such insinuations have been recognised in hindsight as a significant influence on the voting of the British public and many feel that the retraction of that notion is unjust.

attributes.action: stop councils using loose chippings as surface repair
attributes.background: Councils need to stop wasting money on surface chipping and do repairs to the road as it damage's vehicles

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Publish a database registering all the Brexit questions and current answers.
attributes.background: As we move closer to Brexit we must all be positive and engage with Government on all of the questions arising from exit some will be simple others more complex but the both the Nation and the EU must know the current UK position.
attributes.additional_details:
Today the Scottish First Minister demanded action on the position of EU national living in the UK.
Friday 3 questions were raised in the Scottish Parliament. The position on the EU arrest warrant, EU Student studying in the UK and  one other.
But as we progress there will be many questions which will make there way to a Bill that goes before parliament. All we ask is to be kept in the picture

attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.
